Content.Text:
<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Come, <MYNAME> dear. Time to rise and shine!

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Good morning, <MYNAME>.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
You woke up like a lead weight the first two
days, but this morning you bounced right up.
Now you're getting the swing of things!

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Your body's already falling into the rhythm of
farm life. Maybe you're more suited to this than
you thought.
<PAGE>
Well, time to get moving. Today, I'll be teaching
you how to work the fields.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Raising crops is one of a farmer's most basic
responsibilities, and one of their most important.
<PAGE>
Let's go outside.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Before we get started, let me give you the tools
you'll need. First is a <BLUE>hoe</BLUE>.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
How about you try tilling a field for practice?
Equip the hoe and try digging at the ground.
<PAGE>
To equip your hoe, you can <BLUE>press the X Button</BLUE>
to open your bag, but there's another way you
may find more convenient.
<PAGE>
<BLUE>Press the R Button</BLUE> to open right into your bag's
equipment page. This is the <BLUE>Fast Access Menu</BLUE>.
<PAGE>
You can choose the hoe and equip it right from
there, so you don't actually need to open your
bag and find the right page.
<PAGE>
Once you equip the hoe, <BLUE>press the A Button</BLUE> to
till the field. You can <BLUE>hold the A Button</BLUE> to keep
on tilling...
<PAGE>
...And use the <BLUE>Circle Pad</BLUE> to walk forward while
tilling. That's useful if you're tilling a lot of
ground at once.
<PAGE>
Just remember, you'll need to till the same spot
a few times in a row to finish a field.
<PAGE>
Now, how about you try tilling a field right here?
Come see me once you've finished, okay?

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Till the ground with your hoe to prepare a field.
You'll need to till the ground a few times before
it's ready.
<PAGE>
To equip your hoe, <BLUE>press the R Button</BLUE> and
select the hoe. Good luck, dear.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
My, my! And where do you think you're going
with that field in such a state? Back to tilling
with you.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Well done, dear. That's a wonderful little field
you've got there.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Next, try planting these <BLUE>turnip seeds</BLUE>.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Plant them right here in the field you just tilled.
<PAGE>
All you need to do is equip the seeds, then stand
on a tilled field and <BLUE>press the A Button</BLUE>.
<PAGE>
To equip seeds, you can <BLUE>press the X Button</BLUE> to
open your bag and choose them from there...
<PAGE>
Or you can <BLUE>press the R Button twice</BLUE> to open the
<BLUE>Fast Access Menu</BLUE> and view all the seeds you
have.
<PAGE>
If you run out of seeds, just let me know. I'll give
you another bag.
<PAGE>
Now give it a try, dear. Once you've finished,
come see me.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Try planting some seeds in the field you just
tilled, dear.
<PAGE>
<BLUE>Press the R Button twice</BLUE> to open the Fast
Access Menu's seed tab, then choose the seeds
you want.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hold on a minute. You haven't even planted all
the seeds! Come on now, I know you can do it.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh dear. Have you run out of seeds? Here, have
some more.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Good. It looks like you've finished planting.
<PAGE>
Last but not least, once you've planted the
seeds, you have to water them. I'll give you my
old <BLUE>watering can</BLUE> to use.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You can equip the watering can the same way
you did with the hoe. Press the <BLUE>X Button</BLUE> or <BLUE>the
R Button</BLUE> and choose the watering can.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
With the watering can equipped, stand in front
of the <BLUE>well fountain</BLUE> and <BLUE>press the A Button</BLUE> to fill
it.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Once the watering can has been filled, you can
<BLUE>press the A Button</BLUE> to water things.
<PAGE>
When watering crops, <RED>be sure to keep watering
the same spot until it's good and wet.</RED>
<PAGE>
You'll know when it's done when the <RED>white grid
lines</RED> go away.
<PAGE>
Just like with the hoe, you can <BLUE>hold the A
Button</BLUE> to keep watering and walk forward to
cover a wide area.
<PAGE>
Once you have finished watering the field, come
talk to me, okay?

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You haven't quite watered everything yet, dear.
Keep at it.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
My, my! Where do you think you're going now?
You've got a field to water.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
There! Well done, <MYNAME>.
<PAGE>
Field work takes a lot of stamina, so be sure to
keep an eye on it. You don't want to collapse,
after all.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>If you don't water your fields, the crops will dry
up and wilt, so be sure to tend to them
regularly.
<PAGE>
Why don't you keep taking care of the field you
just planted? Once you harvest it, you can do
whatever you like with the crops.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Now then, as a reward for your good work, I'll let
you keep the hoe and the watering can.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
They might be a bit worn, but they've still got
plenty of farming life left in 'em.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
There should be some turnips ready to harvest
tomorrow, so we'll practice gathering crops
then.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
That's about it for today's chores. You can take
the rest of the day for leisure, so why not make
a visit to the town?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>The townsfolk are all wonderful people. I'm sure
you'll make more than a few friends there!

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Oh dear. It looks like that didn't go too well.
<PAGE>
Why don't you give it another try?
<BLUE>Planting Seeds</BLUE> was added to your bookshelf.
<BLUE>Tilling Fields</BLUE> was added to your bookshelf.
<BLUE>Watering</BLUE> was added to your bookshelf.
I got an <BLUE>Old Hoe</BLUE> and an <BLUE>Old Watering Can</BLUE>!
<BLUE>Drying Crops</BLUE> was added to your shelf.

Using a Hoe (Hoe Equipped)
  Till: <BLUE>Press the A Button</BLUE>.

<RED>NOTE: Hold the A Button to continue tilling.
You can walk forward while tilling.</RED>

Planting Seeds (Seeds Equipped)
  Plant: <BLUE>Press the A Button</BLUE>.

<RED>NOTE: Hold the A Button to continue planting
seeds. You can walk forward while planting.</RED>

Using a Watering Can (Watering Can Equipped)
  Water: <BLUE>Press the A Button</BLUE>.

<RED>NOTE: Hold the A Button to continue watering.
You can walk forward while watering.</RED>

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
My, my! How'd you manage to fill your bag
already? Try organizing it to make room for the
new tools.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
My, my! It seems your bag is full. I'll put the
tools into your toolbox, and the rest into your
storage.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh, yes, I almost forgot! All crops have
particular seasons they're best-suited to be
grown in. It's written right there on the bag.
<PAGE>
Once a crop's ideal season has passed, they'll
wilt right away. When you're planting, keep a
careful eye on when the seasons will change.
<PAGE>
You can cut down wilted crops with a <BLUE>sickle</BLUE>.
You can buy those down in the town General
Store.
<PAGE>
I'll put a book explaining the details on your
bookshelf. If you aren't sure what to do, you can
always thumb through it.
<BLUE>Neighbors</BLUE> was added to your shelf.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
This is your first time going to town by yourself,
so let me explain how to read the map.
<PAGE>
Take a look at the bottom screen. See the map
there?
<PAGE>
Touch it to toggle between the full map and the
map of your present location.
<PAGE>
In town, you can press the <BLUE>house icon</BLUE> in the
bottom left corner to display shop and building
names.
<PAGE>
Press the <BLUE>arrow icon</BLUE> to display a route from
wherever you are back to your home. Don't be
afraid to use it!

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Once you reach town, why don't you visit the
General Store straight to your left? It's run by old
Mr. Otmar.
<PAGE>
The Carpenter's Shop is at the southern end of
town. I'm sure you'll need their help many a
time, so why not pay a visit?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>It's not all about work, you know. The more
friends you make with the people in town, the
more enjoyable farm life will be!
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>Hm? How do you go about making friends with
them? Let's see...
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>How about giving them presents as a sign of
your good will? No one I know would turn away
a freebie!
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>If you want to learn more about how to make
friends and influence people, you can read the
book I've put on your bookshelf.
<PAGE>
Now then, here's your allowance for today. Go
on and have some fun!
Received 500G.
